channel.title: I need some help on a first script

item.title: I need some help on a first script
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

retributionmike:

Thanks, works great. So I should use “If” findcolor. Right? it just checks to see if there is that color there and if it is, it stores its coords and whatnot. woot i lern gud thanks again

Yep, good job, and no problem.

Also, when using if statements they only excecute on thign after it. So, if you want it to do two things, (such as in your script where you Click the mouse and wait) You have to have if statement excecute a begin clause. Therefore, it will do everything after the begin statement, until the script hits the end; that follows it.

Glad to see new scripters learning!

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help on a first script

item.title: I need some help on a first script
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Hmmm, I added if statements to your color finding, and added standards.

Try this:

[code]program broncotrolleys;

//
// Made By retributionmike
// Game Link - http://www.homestarrunner.com/broncotrolleys.html
//

{.include si.txt}
const
trisket = 19574;//color of the trisket
pnutbuda = 233;//color of the red letters on the peanut butter jar
orange = 11515580;//color of the orange
trolleystomake = 100;//how many bronco trolleys do you want to make
var
x1, x2, x3, y1, y2, y3, a : integer;

procedure treskut;
begin
if findcolor(x1, y1, trisket, 0, 0, 548, 398) then
begin
clickmouse(x1, y1, true)
wait(300);
end;
end;

procedure peenutbooter;
begin
if findcolor(x2, y2, pnutbuda, 0, 0, 548, 398) then
begin
clickmouse(x2,y2, true)
wait(300);
end;
end;

procedure oj;
begin
if findcolor(x3, y3, orange, 0, 0, 548, 398) then
begin
clickmouse(x3, y3, true)
wait(300)
end;
end;

Begin
Repeat
treskut;
peenutbooter;
oj;
a:=a+1;
Until(a=trolleystomake)
Writeln(‘bronco trolleys are made, winned k’)
End.[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help on a first script

item.title: I need some help on a first script
item.dc:creator: @retributionmike retributionmike
item.description:
@retributionmike wrote:

I was playing around on homestar runner and playing the “Bronco Trolleys” Game, then I decided I wanted to make a script for it.

Here it is.

program broncotrolleys;

//
//   Made By retributionmike
//   Game Link - http://www.homestarrunner.com/broncotrolleys.html
//

{.include si.txt}
const
trisket = 19574;//color of the trisket
pnutbuda = 233;//color of the red letters on the peanut butter jar
orange = 11515580;//color of the orange
trolleystomake = 4;//how many bronco trolleys do you want to make
var
x1, x2, x3, y1, y2, y3, a : integer;



procedure treskut;
begin
findcolor(x1, y1, trisket, 0, 0, 548, 398)
clickmouse(x1, y1, true)
wait(300)
end;

procedure peenutbooter;
begin
findcolor(x2, y2, pnutbuda, 0, 0, 548, 398)
clickmouse(x2,y2, true)
wait(300)
end;

procedure oj;
begin
findcolor(x3, y3, orange, 0, 0, 548, 398)
clickmouse(x3, y3, true)
wait(300)
end;


Begin
Repeat
treskut
peenutbooter
oj
a:=a+1
Until(a=trolleystomake)
Writeln('bronco trolleys are made, winned k')
End.

Im pretty sure after about a couple seconds of looking at the game, youll understand what my script does.
But the problem(s) I need help fixing are;

  • When it loops, it just clicks the spot where the triscuits, peanut butter, and oranges WERE, like its not clearing the information the variables are holding or whatever it does. so it just clicks the same three spots over and over.

  • Is there anything else that would seem to make the script more efficient?

Read full topic
item.source: I need some help on a first script
